I only play ARAM 20-25% of the time but awesome changes.  While there are probably some more things that could have been adjusted, you got so many nuances in this patch right:

- Allowing mastery points on other maps BUT NOT Rank 6/7 tokens.

- All the subtle rules of /remake (tilt exception; diamond players)

- Increasing the damage back up from Grasp while reducing the lifesteal

- The 10 AD bump to the Last Whisper items was extremely needed

- Basically every ARAM change

>Allowing mastery points on other maps BUT NOT Rank 6/7 tokens.

The restriction is absolutely absurd though. Riot's reasoning is that a high competitive standard is necessary for high Mastery levels, yet they exclude ranked Treeline and include blind normal SR. That sends a terrible message to Treeline players when Riot is publicly claiming that a ranked queue is somehow innately less competitive than a normal queue. The claim might be true in a practical sense due to playerbase size and dev support differences, but enforcing it as a natural truth is completely ridiculous and harmful.

It's not that Treeline is less competitive, it's that it's less rigorously balanced.

Personally, I'm a little sad that Treeline isn't considered worth balancing, or that we're not being surveyed or anything over our interest levels.

I don't play Treeline hardly ever. When I get three people that will, I have a good time. But if I know someone who mains a champion who is weak on Treeline, I usually don't bother asking. If I don't get three people, I'm low enough Treeline MMR to get matched with bot accounts quite often.

A maintained Treeline loses these problems, and becomes a fun alternative to the main game and would help the player retention problems Riot likely will start encountering.
